comment: Here's the thing. It is ridiculous to humanize animals while they are  FYI  not human. They are social  sentient  etc. because it is natural  it is instinct. So does with natural selection and food chain. And FYI  we  human  are also an animal but we have been privileged to be the top of the food chain. So it's something that inevitable. Veganism is good  as a marketing and consumer style  but not as moral compass. So the solution is by doing it ethically. And in terms of ethical  I mean produced it in a way that scientifically clean whether or not it looks gross to you  i.e. slitting the throat will take out the blood completely and makes the meat cleaner. So everything should be done in moderation. And by moderation  keep the food chain balanced. Don't over-consume or under-consume. Can you imagine if we don't eat chicken  especially chickens that lived nearby human settlement? they will graze the farm  houses  etc. Because there is no natural predator for them. We are the natural predator.  But what about greenhouse gasses that' has been emitted? Duh  that's why we should make electric cars  sustainable water irigation  stop the coal and oil mining  etc.

I'm native american and I have hunted before the traditional way (bow arrow club) and with a gun. it was awesome and now he's hanging on my wall and not eating the baby chicks.  I'm in the fence about trapping. Coyotes are considered a nuisance for a reason. They aren't big but they can be a problem when too close to home. comment: All of you who are posting these asinine comments on PETA's videos need to consider something: you aren't making a difference in the world  PETA and their supporters are. We are winning and the best you people can do is post comments to get a laugh. If all of you despise this organization  why don't you do something about it? Why don't you do something to resolve the issue  stand up for what you think is right  like PETA does? I'll tell you why: because none of you have the courage to. You all are nothing but people sitting at your computers  doing nothing to support nothing but yourselves. Your ignorance  immaturity  disrespect and petty trolling is what makes us stronger. We are winning the battle for animals  and there is absolutely nothing any of you *will do about it but make "witty" post on the internet* Animals will have their salvation;  things are changing at a very swift pace in the world. So  yes  make all of the fun of PETA you would like  it's not going to prevent us from completing our mission. Thank you.

comment: Most suppliers use animals that were going to die anyways  either from sickness or fatal injuries. While freezing and drowning are terrible ways to kill an animal  euthanasia will most likely ruin organs that would need to be studied.   Also: do you think Leonardo da Vinci cared when he opened up human bodies for research? No. But it was crucial to the medical and science field. The same has happened for literally every animal species known to man. By gathering this information we are able to cure illnesses that we wouldn't have known about if we hadnt studied the animal's bodies  and possibly would have let many more die because of it.   Now I'm not defending the dissection of this many animals; I believe this event should only happen in a scientific environment. Not every Highschooler in every school everywhere needs to open one.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: I agree that this procedure is disturbing and I would not do it to any animal  but I think some context is needed. 1) this procedure  producing what is called parabiosis  is used to study the specific role of immune/blood cells or aging. It allows researchers to study the specific role of specific cell types in diseases and infections through a "continual transfusion" method. 2) this is the LAST resort approved method to study immune responses/aging  like those mentioned  used only when other methods cannot be. Approval to use such a procedure is only given if all other methods would be inaccurate. The Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee at any institution does not allow this procedure unless all other avenues have been explored.  I am NOT trying to justify the use of the procedure  merely provide CONTEXT. As presented  this video makes it seem as though it is being used just to make franken-mice. Veterinary staff and researchers would NOT do this unless they met the above mentioned requirements and are trying to study disease to improve medical treatments. Our understanding of HIV  Sickle cell anemia  lymphoma  and other blood diseases has  unfortunately  come from this procedure. Current treatments for people who suffer with the disease would not exist without it.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: At my school  we dissected rats. Of course my friends and I didn't  but everyone else was excited to cut up an animal. They were saying things like  "I can't wait to see it's guts!" Or perhaps  "I'm gonna chop off it's head!" And things worse. Nobody took it seriously.  I remember when we were out in the hallway doing our rat research and quiz  just three of us  my teacher told us to deliver a box of toothpicks to another teacher downstairs. When we got there she told us to tell the art teacher she didn't need them anymore because we'd taken care of it. We got back up and saw my art teacher just barely walk into the classroom. She stepped in and came out crying  purely because she has two pet rats. (Which are the sweetest things in the world  i've known this teacher since I was young) And we talked her through it. She didn't know the dissection was happening. It's mind scarring  really.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: I wrote a poem about animal testing.  "You too" I struggle in pain as you scream at me. My heart is breaking everyday. My feet are sore  my tears are rolling. What did I ever do to you? I see the others  shocked and dead. I run in circles in my prison  filled with dread. I cry out everyday  but you still wont listen. I am taken out of my cage  i think im being freed! Oh no  whats that? That gray thing over there? You bring me to it and hold me tight. I feel something sharp being struck into my back. My eyes burn as you put on something black. My skin is wounded as you spray mist on me. My beautiful fur is gone falling  as you rub something on it. I am a experimental dog. I feel pain too.   Why? Why could you be so cruel?  They told me dogs jump around in big fields. Catching frisbees  getting rubs  and sleeping on a bed. But this is a hell  a hell for dogs.  A small crate in a dark room is no place for a dog. Nor do syringes or mascara belong on me. I am a dog.  I donot look like you. I donot feel like you. I donot smell like you. But I am human too.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: If PETA moved all of its spending away from self-defeating  shaming inquisitions  and *reinvested everything into research and development of tissue engineering for the purposes of creating economically viable  death-free meat*   the organization would save the lives of billions of animals. Thus far PETA has only invested a few million dollars into in-vitro meat. Though a tiny number of lab grown meat products have made it to grocery stores  there remain massive hurdles if traditional slaughterhouse meat is to be challenged. It's not just around the corner. Engineered Meat has to be leaner  tastier  healthier  cheaper  etc if any progress is to be made. PETA's vanity is killing the dream of cruelty free meat.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: Having lived in Brazil about 5 years ago it is utterly disgusting how much rain forest is being wiped out recently - not because of logging or mining  although that used to play a significant part  but because of the American and European demand for produce. For every acre of rain forest being razed 2 out of 3 acres of newly developed land is being devoted for new farmland to keep up with the profitable vegan trend. Remember this - the plant ripped out by its roots screams as loud as the slaughtered cow  chicken or pig; it's just that the liberals haven't learned to hear those screams yet.

comment: Texas has Mohair farms mostly in Edwards Plateau. So why not find folks who treat their goats well instead of just not having Mohair goats? Clipping the hair isn't harmful. It is stupid to mistreat your goats or not provide them proper shelter and care. Bad for business and bad for goats. Rather than trash the entire industry  then why not encourage purchase of mohair from farms that treat goats with proper husbandry?
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: Not every shearing activity is as painful and inhumane like the one shown on the video. I think these are few isolated incidences and should be addressed separately. If people stop using mohair products  it'll be equally as cruel/inhumane when goats  being very sensitive to heat  have to carry heavy fleece due to not being sheared. If we attribute this to the mohair industry at large  what's next? Are going to ban wool production as well due to some few farmers' malpractices that should be looked at separately? These people doing these activities should be charged and their actions should not affect others who still get the fleece off the goat without cruelty.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: The cruelty in this video is shocking!  However  does it mean that this cruelty happens at ALL the Angora goat farms in SA?  Mohair is the end product of Angora goats  like wool is from sheep.  Carrying a goat kid or a lamb by the front legs  is done all over the world and is not cruel if done properly.  How many goat backs are broken during shearing sessions?    Were these incidents of cruelty reported to the concerned parties and organisations(Animal anti cruelty/SPCA/Agri SA/CMW) in South Africa BEFORE a ban on mohair was requested?  How about providing the name of the farm and farmer (naming and shaming) in the video BEFORE the entire mohair industry is smeared? It would appear that some dead goats were photographed during a  disastrous drought  or after an unexpected snow storm. I am not a farmer or Angora breeder  but a South African who has been to farms where these cruel atrocities DO NOT happen!!!
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: PETA keeps putting out videos on shit they don't understand  yes  their are times when animals are abused  but it's no where near as common as it's made out to be  and a lot of the things that are claimed as cruelty aren't really  it's just people misunderstanding what's actually going on. The worker that "stepped on the sheep's head" was actually just holding the sheep's head out of the way  not resting his wait on it  same with the shearer who was "resting his full wait on the sheep"  most of his wait is either on his left foot  or on the right foot behind the sheep  he is just using his knee to hold the sheep down.  Cuts are often sown up without painkillers  buts it's better than the alternative of leaving the wound open to get infected. Sheep are pretty tough animals  often they won't even flinch when being sown up  also in more serious wounds  disinfectants are usually applied  which often an numbing effect added to them.  Having pretty much grown up on a wool farm and in the shearing sheds  and being an amateur shearer myself  when animal rights groups like peta try and make agricultural industry's out to be trying to be cruel to the animals in just Stinks of bull shit  yes  the main foucus on the animals is that they are profitable  but the welfare of the animals very often goes hand in hand with that  I.e. A healthy sheep in good nick will produce a much better fleece than and sick batters up sheep.

comment: You're right  the fur/animalmeat industries often abuse animals  and they suffer needlessly. Modern industrial farms are disgusting and any health-conscious person should avoid that food. But do you (vegans) think there's anything wrong with killing a deer  for example  as long as you do so in moderation (only when needed)  respect the animals  and let none of it go to waste? This is how our primitive forebears lived  and survived. How can there be anything wrong with quickly killing your prey  if you respect its life and waste none of it? Killing other animals is not only a human  behavior - all secondary consumers do this. That is to say  it's a fundamental aspect of life. So surely you're not opposed to the fact that animals (including humans) kill other animals  but only to modern industrial farms that make animals suffer  right?

comment: Admit it you PETA people: The White race  and especialy Western Europeans  are really the only people of this earth who even care at all about animal rights. And so it makes sense that the whole animal rights movement in its totality was born with the National Socialist Savitri Devi and her immortal book 'Impeachment of Man'. There is NO other book that is so comprehensive in its scope of what all this movement encompasses. It is the bible..the very birth of animal rights. And it was published in 1959. Savitri Devi CANNOT be ignored. If you ignore her  you are wallowing in ignorance and hypocrisy. So for those of you who are liberals  and are not afraid to go outside that modern liberal box of thinking  I urge you to get a copy of 'Impeachment of Man'. It won't disappoint. Also  the first government regime in the world to outlaw vivisection and enforce jail terms for people who committed animal cruelty was none other than Hitler's Germany. The following paragraph is from the book 'Impeachment of Man' by Savitri Devi (1959): Yet  along with the apparently healthy condition of the horses he meets in the streets  there is one thing that cannot but favorably impress a lover of animals on his arrival in England or Germany  and that is the special care generally given in those countries to cats and dogs. I shall never forget the sight that greeted me on a cold November night of 1945  as I walked out of Victoria Station in London  coming from India: a magnificent  panther-like cat  fiery yellow with tawny stripes  fat and glossy  his tail erect; an animal accustomed to be loved  that was not afraid of human beings  but came at once when I called him. I took him up in my arms. How heavy he was! I thought of the dozens and dozens of miserable starving cats which I used to feed in India; of the hundreds and thousands that have remained out of my reach: of all the creatures  all over the world  that are born  live and die without knowing a human caress. And tears fell from my eyes as I stroked the soft  thick  royal  furry creature that purred and purred in response to my touch. And - although I had  on ideological grounds  actively fought against her during the war - I blessed England from the depth of my heart  "Whatever be their rulers - or those who sit and 'pull the strings' at the back of these - HER PEOPLE  of overwhelmingly Nordic stock  are thorougly good " thought I.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: Ironically  the day you disrupted a ceremony to honor the accomplishments of Texas A&M students  the FDA approved the drug being developed there to enter human clinical trials.  The treatment is for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy  which affects 1 in 3500 babies  causing progressive muscle weakness  followed by death in their mid-20's.  I would join you in support if I really thought the use of these animals was inappropriate  that the suffering was needless or excessive.  I don't.  I welcome anyone to provide oversight  express concern  but know that medical researchers also love animals  and care about their well being.  We're not monsters  and we're also carefully watching animal research for needless cruelty or unethical conduct.  It's not always perfect  and can be a little upsetting  but it's also upsetting to watch your son  who has never been able to walk  die in his early 20's from a disease that could be treated or cured.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

I'll be separating the mother from the calf  but only until the calf immune system builds up. It will be for a month and 1 day. Will I AI them? Nope since that I'm going to be working with miniature cattles  I don't need to use AI. I don't see AI as rape  but kinda gross. However  bulls are dangerous ( miniature bulls are easier to work with and are less dangerous from what I've read )  so why can see  some farms use AI. Change of plan. I will have to seprate the mothers from the calves even longer. Sorry vegans and ARA  but I done more research on why calves are taken way from thwor mothers. comment: Okay  now that I get the whole point of this video  I'll now explain it.  Last year  in my Home Economics class  there were some people who visited our school to explain about how the chickens are kept and how they're taken care of. They're in free-range farms  yes  but they're allowed to run around freely outside during daytime. It's only during nighttime that they're going back into the barn  and the next day they're releases again to run around the grass field.  Plus  they also brought some chickens and chicks as well to show us  and they looked absolutely fine! No plucked feathers  no wounds  nothing! The chickens were very huge and plump  and their plumage was very smooth. It was a sign that they're healthy.  Same with the juveniles  and the newborn chicks (juveniles looked a bit scruffy but they're still healthy).  Even if these chickens did go back inside the barn  it's only when they sleep. They weren't crammed like that or anything. If they were  they wouldn't have looked so healthy.  I don't know where this community have investigated  but please keep in mind that not all farms are like that. In Canada  the rules against animals are a bit strict and I bet they won't allow the farms to treat animals like this at all. Don't demonize every single farms  please.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: Yes. Its about time. I saw what the monkeys went through for other types of research. Its all very sad. I cry for all of the animals. I was conditioned  as a child  to always eat meat as a protien source and i hated looking and eating meat. Blood vessels n tendons disgusted me. I loved meatless dishes. I had to stay at the dining room until i finished everything. This was at a Convent called St. Agathas   in Rockland County. Now  at age 58  I've spent years  just eating only veggie dishes. I've loved animal's at a young age. I had my Shetland Pony  named Ivanhoe  for three years. He was killed outside the barn  by some really bad boys  at the Convent. They threw big rocks at his head for a joke. I was 11 years old and have been traumatized my whole life. I don't open up about it  but I felt the need to now.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: Good lord y'all are super annoying. Yes it is often unethical to test things on dogs and other Animals  but bitching to the schools won't solve anything. The FDA and other Federal inspection agencies require companies to go through multiple levels of testing to get a product allowed on the market. Martin Shkreli (The man I'm sure you all hate) was even quoted saying that he hated that he had to do testing on dogs  but the government required that he do it. Putting up your baloons and asking these schools and companies to stop testing is absolutely stupid  and all you will do is slow down progress.
channelId: PETA (People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals)

comment: i don't think we make animals our slaves  it's the animals that make US humans the slave to them  think about it  it's humans that must feed water  change litterboxes  walk the dogs  give them baths  give them pet treats  take them to the vet if needed  play with them  tell me "peta" who is the real slave here? for entertainment  we would have very little family films  we would never have lord of the rings  no westerns  i don't even think we would have tribbles from star trek  cause they are fluffy and cute  even if they weren't real. you might even be crazy enough to hate on animated animal movies such as nearly anything made by Disney.i even heard you had a beef with mario and his flying coon outfit. *stupid as stupid does i guess* as for experimenting  Well that is a hit or miss really. good to get much needed cures and items for cleaning ourselves  *in your case  smell ya later* but they really shouldn't be poking rats and monkey. what we need are peta members to do all experiments on instead  for what better than humans to try and create things for humans  right? so i ask all peta members willing  go out to the scientific places  free the animals and take thier place instead! now for the part of wearing animal skin  whatever.I'll wear that cow  bunny dog or whatever else there might be  and if you throw blood on my nice jacket  I'll take your skin and wear you instead. so don't even think about it. remember what happen to peta on southpark? that was probably the best episode ever.
